messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] lights and voices
messages.msgSnippet: On Mon, 21 Oct 2002 11:01:12 +0200 Alan & Brenda Leonard ... Yes, he really is.  He s so much like his dad it s amazing.  I met his dad when I was about
messages.messageBody:
On Mon, 21 Oct 2002 11:01:12 +0200 Alan & Brenda Leonard
<abtleo@...> writes:

> He IS funny! <g>

Yes, he really is. He's so much like his dad it's amazing. I met his
dad when I was about Dylan's age and David was 13. It's fun to see.
They have the quickest, sharp humor.

He's just gone outside to play, bundled up because it's chilly here and
he took a bag with him to pick up apples. (He wants to put all the
apples in a pile for the deer when they come) He came and kissed me and
said good bye mom, I'll write when I get work. <g>

He has me grinning all day.

Deb L

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] lights and voices
messages.msgSnippet: ... Um, Deb -- He IS funny!   Sorry about the migraine, tho.  Ugh. brenda
messages.messageBody:
10/21/02 06:01:

> The other day when I was having the flashes of light that signal an
> oncoming migraine my son lovingly patted me on the hand and said, "I'm
> sorry mom... but the lights are better than the voices."
> He really thinks he's funny!

Um, Deb --

He IS funny! <g>
Sorry about the migraine, tho. Ugh.

brenda
